DOC.brief_title: The Influence Motor Imagery Fine Motor Skills
DOC.detailed_description: Imagery cognitive process play important role plan execution different movement action . The main purpose study ascertain whether application Motor Imagery together normal practice improve fine motor skill disabled individual . In study participate 42 subject gender disability , mean age 37 ( SD=12 ) . Subjects randomly divide two group : control group experimental one . The study procedure apply five different task Psychomotor Battery fine motor skill ( BPM ) . This instrument apply two stage , begin study ( pretest ) end 4 week ( posttest ) . Both group perform task twice week month . Motor imagery session add experimental group . Participants experimental group ask mentally imagine recreate task perform earlier initial assessment . For analysis result , descriptive inferential statistic use . The T-test independent sample , T-test pair sample apply .
DOC.criteria: institutionalized individual individual disability able perform motor task individual hear disability individual visual disability individual without motor autonomy
